description: REST APIs, making requests, building APIs with FastAPI, authentication, and error handling

cards.back:
A web API following REST conventions:

GET /users        — list all users
GET /users/42     — get user 42
POST /users       — create a user
PUT /users/42     — replace user 42
DELETE /users/42  — delete user 42

The URL is the resource. The HTTP method is the action.

cards.front: How do you make a GET request and parse the JSON response?
cards.back:
import requests

response = requests.get("https://api.example.com/posts/1")
post = response.json()    # parse JSON to dict
print(post["title"])
print(response.status_code)  # 200

cards.front: How do you create a simple API with FastAPI?
What are the two main API authentication methods?
How should you handle API errors?
cards.back:
# BAD — crashes if API is down:
data = requests.get(url).json()

# GOOD — check response first:
response = requests.get(url, timeout=10)
response.raise_for_status()  # raises on 4xx/5xx
data = response.json()

Always: set timeout, check status, handle exceptions.

cards.front: Why should you use a base URL variable instead of hardcoding?
cards.back:
# BAD — hard to change:
requests.get("https://api.example.com/v2/users")
requests.get("https://api.example.com/v2/posts")

# GOOD — one place to change:
BASE_URL = "https://api.example.com/v2"
requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/users")
requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/posts")

Easier to switch between dev/staging/production.

cards.front: What are good free APIs for practice?
cards.back:
JSONPlaceholder (jsonplaceholder.typicode.com) — fake posts, users
Open Meteo (open-meteo.com) — weather data
PokeAPI (pokeapi.co) — Pokemon data
REST Countries (restcountries.com) — country info

All free, no API key needed, safe to practice with.

cards.front: How do you send data with a POST request?
cards.back:
import requests

new_post = {
    "title": "My Post",
    "body": "Content here",
    "userId": 1
}

response = requests.post(
    "https://api.example.com/posts",
    json=new_post  # auto-serializes to JSON
)
print(response.status_code)  # 201 Created
